utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: Hi, good afternoon.

utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm participant number sixty.

utterances.transcript: Okay, and would I be able to get your name?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Sure, my name is Jo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi Jo.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hi.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's yo~ %uh your name is Lynnette, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Lynnette, nice to meet you Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay Jo, may- how may I help you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh yes %um I like to %uh plan a tour to Singapore %uh some time in I guess mid-August.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh that's when my birthday is.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I'd like to know %uh where can I go, what can I do for about two days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Two days in Singapore, %uh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now, in August actually the first week of August, Singapore is going to celebrate our birthday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh wow, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But that would be mid-August for you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, %um I actually took a look at the calendar and about August seventeen, eighteen, nineteen, that sounds about right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that should be %uh Saturday, Sunday %hm- no, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Friday, Saturday, Sunday if I'm not mistaken.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And- Friday to Sunday, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh what are your what would you- what are you thinking of doing here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Actually %um I'm not sure, but %uh I do love the beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh are there any beaches in Singapore or even close by?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we do have nice beaches on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I've heard about Sentosa, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could do your swimming and other activities on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we do have also a beach on the mainland Singapore %uh but it's just a simple beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, and what do you mean by simple beach?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's not like %uh white sands, %Uh what do you mean by simple beach?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because %um I'm actually looking for white sands and very calm seas.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: so how are the beaches in Sentosa and mainland Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the mainland of Singapore, we have our beach over at the East Coast.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so when I said "simple", %uh yes we don't have white sand on the East Coast Beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, we have pretty deep sea water around the coastline of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I would say that is not very calm sea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so I would think %uh Sentosa beaches would be more to your liking because you have a beautiful beach out there, in fact there are a few.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and also %uh very calm because the waters there are pretty calm.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because you can actually swim inside the lagoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: %Oh okay, right.

utterances.transcript: So I'm going to show you %uh the Sentosa.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Alright, I'm gonna just show you Sentosa and I'm just going to show you some of the beaches we have.

utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Right, it is.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and the other one will be Tanjong Beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so they are all very nice beaches on %uh Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, impressive, very good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is the one the Sentosa Beach %uh I'm talking about, okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So nice %uh clean and calm waters, I think that would suit what you are looking for.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %um is August a good month to go to Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How's the weather like in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have summer the whole year around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there is no %uh differences on whether you are coming in January or December, %uh in terms of our weather.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just in December the weather gets one degree cooler, that's all.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just one degree cooler?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh and what about the freak weather storms like %uh tornados or hurricanes, anything like that in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that common in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no we- Fortunately here we don't have %uh the natural disaster, because we, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We don't have %uh earthquakes, we don't have tornados.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what we have here would be just very mild monsoon rain.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or I would say very heavy rains, that's about it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Mild monsoon rains.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, and what month are those?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um okay it's generally happening in %uh the month of November.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can still come because %uh although you may have heavy rains, the rains do %uh stop, alright, after a short while.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so we do have people coming to Singapore from January to December.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: November.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um actually %um  I do see the site right now and %um the beaches on Sentosa.

utterances.transcript: it's comparable to what famous beach around the world?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I think we are very different.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our beaches are I would say man-made, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh they are very safe to swim because %uh you have %uh what we call lagoons.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Lagoons, okay, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so it's safe to swim in the lagoons and also in the lagoons itself, you have these buoys.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So as long as you're just swimming inside the buoys, you are actually I would say very safe.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you are looking at the safe place %uh to swim and very convenient to the hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh that would something that I would recommend.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Actually my main activity when I go to the beaches %uh is snorkelling.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no, we- I would not recommend you to go snorkelling in Sentosa.

utterances.transcript: %Uh we normally do I would say scuba diving off %uh the Southern Islands of Singapore.

utterances.transcript: %Oh scuba diving.

utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We normally would not %uh do snorkelling %uh on Sentosa island.

utterances.transcript: %Oh %uh is there a place in Singapore where we can go snorkelling?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh like I said no, unfortunately.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh we do more of %uh scuba diving of the off-shores Islands of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um so what else?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay on Sentosa-

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: %Oh %uh actually it's %uh my wife and my son, my ten-year-old son and we all love snorkelling.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But yah if you can tell me a few more things that we can do maybe %uh you could convince us to go to Sentosa.

utterances.transcript: Okay, well %uh I think that the your child would be interested in this %uh attraction called the Butterfly Park and Insect Kingdom.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and in this small little Park, you get to see all this insects.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And part of inside the park itself, you will also be walking through an %uh open-air, as you can see, you see the butterflies are just parked.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or %uh they just %uh hang on to the person itself, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so yah and as you can see the scorpion as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so these are- this is a small %uh but very compact butterfly kingdom , %uh butterfly park and insect kingdom.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I think if your son is %uh very much into a little bit more adventurous and a little bit more exciting or in fact your whole family, yourself and your wife included, you could go and do this mega-zip adventure park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's like an obstacle kind of a park, if you can see.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: kind of a thing, yah.

utterances.transcript: So these are the some of the games or sport you can do on %uh Sentosa itself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Alright, sounds interesting.

utterances.transcript: So this is not a resort or is this a resort?

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Okay, and what's that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this Merlion is a symbol of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh half lion and half fish tail, okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And, yes, so you can actually do %uh a sort of %uh go inside the lion and take the lift right up to the mouth of lion and have good eye view of %uh Sentosa and even towards Indonesia.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh okay so it's hollow inside?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: so people can actually go inside.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: Alri~ %um I'm guessing there is a fee for this, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: how much is it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the admission into this Merlion Park is eight dollars for an adult, and five dollars for child.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if your child is ten, yes that would be child rate.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh that's %uh Singaporean dollars, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, everything will be in Singapore dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, how much is that in- %oh what's the conversion rate for %uh US dollars to Singapore dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh one US dollars will give you approximately about a one dollar and twenty seven cents Singapore money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this one US dollar will give you approximately about a dollar twenty seven %uh Singapore %uh money, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you want to make things easier, then it's about a dollar thirty cents.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So one dollar is one twenty five, %uh %huh. I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, I see, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah but it's actually less, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's about a one point two seven at today's rate.

utterances.transcript: Okay, alright, good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so %uh there are other attractions but I will %uh, you know, skip that.

utterances.transcript: Sure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I do.

utterances.transcript: Okay, we have %Uh The Song of the Sea that comes on every night.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so, basically %um when I was researching Singapore, and what we can do in Singapore, %uh the Universal Studios was I think it was the number one thing to do in Singapore.

utterances.transcript: Yes, correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Not on the mainland, yah.

utterances.transcript: So there are- so these are just some of the scenes %uh it's divided into seven zone.

utterances.transcript: Okay, so these are just some of the scene.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is one of the rides.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: Well we have %uh Madagascar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, Hollywood area.

utterances.transcript: I have one question.

utterances.transcript: %Um %uh what- is the peak season in August or is that low season or the lean season?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh we don't really have like a peak season.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe you get a little bit more crowd in June and December because that is also our school holidays here in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and of course some of the public holidays, %um then you get %uh more local people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise %uh I think it would be fairly %uh, it is not like really crowded if you are going into %uh the theme park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so in August %uh so that's a perfect time to go to Singapore?

utterances.transcript: Wow, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.transcript: %Uh yah we don't have major holidays except on the ninth of August, that's our birthday in August.

utterances.transcript: %Oh %uh when is the Singapore birthday in August?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh ninth, on the ninth of August.

utterances.transcript: Ninth of August, that's perfect.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, and we do have a big birthday parade %um %uh in Singapore in the month of August, %uh ninth of August.

utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.transcript: I see, alright.

utterances.transcript: %Uh for one ride, it could take about may be twenty to thirty- may be even to forty five minutes, just to get on the rides but it's not that bad here in %uh Universal Studio Singapore?

utterances.transcript: Yah, that I would say may be Saturday, Sunday, yes you do have to queue a bit of time.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: So you can choose to stay %uh there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, %um. %Uh are there any four-star hotels %uh on the Island?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh no we don't have a four-star hotel %um, the Resort World Hotel would be, I would say they are different category of hotel because they are %uh resorts hotels, right.

utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this one I can recommend you %um this would be %uh the hotel out on %uh the Island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see it's- Okay.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's quite a pretty %uh hotel.

utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay and it's- and the hotel is walking distance from the beach, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's just next to the beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this is %uh Rasa Sentosa Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist

utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right and %um yes if we do %uh decide to got the mainland, %uh what can we do there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh okay, no it-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, that's- so that's why I was planning to go to the mainland.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But now your telling me that it's actually on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So now if we go the mainland, what can we do there?

utterances.transcript: What can we see?

utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, what do your wife, yourself and your child like to see?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I guess %um if %uh actually Sentosa would be probably for me and for my son.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But if we go the mainland, I guess that will be for my wife.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And she likes to shop, so where can we to go shopping?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we had lots of shopping options in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um even the locals like to shop and eat, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %hm a lot of us goes to this road called Orchard Road to do our shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, I've heard of that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And, yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can- you are actually looking at one of our %uh newer shopping centre called Ion on Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you look at the map below, you see the pink highlighted area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's one straight road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright and, yes again you see some of the %uh street seen in Orchard Road, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Full of greenery mature trees and every other building would be  %uh a shopping centre, a hotel, dining area on Orchard Road itself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, and what would- what does she likes to shop for?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: what do you think she will like to shop for?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: She actually likes to go to bargain shops.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I see here that %uh we have pretty high-end shops on Orchard Road %uh, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh are there any places here or roads where they have bargain like for shops or the market?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we don't really call our shops market here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but just on the junction of this building %uh Ion, %uh beside the main road is Orchard Road, the other road is Scotts Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you just walk down, %uh you will come to this shopping mall called the %um %uh Far East Shopping Centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now this sell %uh the I would say the budget and mid-range kind of products %uh that ranges from hair accessories, %uh ear accessories, right up to fashion and shoes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is one option that you may wanna consider.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: All these shops are just one shop, so they don't really have chain shops.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so it's not like the high fashion.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the other place that I would like to recommend %uh for the cheaper options of shopping would be Bugis, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so this is an area, another area again it's the shopping mall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I mean next to the Bugis MRT train station, if you look on your right-hand side.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, you can see Bugis Junction.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so there is a red building just a five minutes from the MRT, %uh and again there are all tiny shops.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so if you want to talk about market then, maybe that would be quite similar to what you are talking about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so there are no branded items there, basically they are just %uh fashionable wear.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the other shopping option.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh would you and your son like to look at any of our war museum federal?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Far East.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh war museums.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not too much war museums, but if you have any science museums or a technology museums.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: My son is more interested in science actually.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I would be able to recommend he- %uh you a science centre which a lot of school children, they like to go to this %uh place call the Science Centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this is %uh a visit to the Science Centre and it's quite interactive as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh again it's very accessible.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can take the subway again, the MRT, and goes towards the Western part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the Science Centre, and your son will, well, enjoy like a few hours %uh in this Science Centre itself, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm going to show you like what are the exhibitions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay in here there are all very interactive.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, inside here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay so some of these are permanent exhibitions and they are always there all the time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But of course at certain time of the year, they have different focus.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's really very interactive, very %um stimulating actually for children as well as for adult.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It looks pretty interesting.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um how much is the entrance fee to this Science Centre?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hello.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm giving you the rates.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, let me just-

utterances.transcript: %Um actually you mention a lot of trips %uh via the MRT.

utterances.transcript: %Uh is it fairly simple to take the MRT to different locations or-

utterances.transcript: Yes, %uh it is very simple to take the %uh MRT.

utterances.transcript: Okay, and there are some English signs there, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That I can understand.

utterances.transcript: Yes, there are %uh signs are all written in English.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's actually very easy to get by.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have just %uh a few line, alright, at the East-West Line and of course the reverse direction, that is the green colour line.

utterances.transcript: And North-South Line will be in red colour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and %uh North-East Line %uh that would be a purple colour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And a second line that is in yellow.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript: %Oh so it's very organised, that's good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh and of course it always go in reverse direction, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So very easy to take the %uh subway, our MRT.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, that's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And every-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: and %uh most of the shops the locations and things to go to, it is accessible via the MRT, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, and how much will it cost me to take the MRT in one direction?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, our MRT is charge as well based on %uh distance travel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let's say if you're in the East, you want to travel down to let say Orchard Road, that would be a cost of %uh approximately about two dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Two dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Two dollars and twenty cents Singapore Dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh, yah so you- since you're only going to spend like two days, I would just recommend you to buy %uh like the standard ticket.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh, the standard ticket and what's that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that like an all-day pass?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. You just buy like a per trip basis.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Per trip.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh is there %uh a ticket like an all-day where I can use that and I can go anywhere I want %uh with that ticket, no?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have like %uh not the one day pass, %uh but we have like a tourist pass.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So because I don't think you're going to travel that much, so I think it is cheaper if you just buy %uh per trip basis.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Per trip basis, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so, yah ea~ your earlier question like how much does it cost in science, nine dollars %uh for- yes, nine dollars the admission.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for child up to sixteen years, that would be five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Nine dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Five dollars for three to six, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's eighteen for five, twenty three, okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Not bad.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah and of course we do have like a four D kind of a show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh again it depends on what show it's gonna show in August.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that's like in a three hundred sixty degrees kind of facility theatre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, and that's not included in the entrance fee, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no, that's an additional of ten dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Additional ten dollars and it's seven dollars for kids.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: three to twelve years old.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But there is option, huh, whether you want to see this show or not.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise %uh-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So basically %um I'm actually %uh off the top of my head.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm calculating how much I would need if I were to go to Singapore %uh for two days.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh and going back to the resort hotel,

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh if I remember correctly it was around four hundred fifty dollars, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, correct.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And that's per night?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay and %um that doesn't include the dinner or breakfast, lunch and dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no, normally our hotels would include the breakfast.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh it would include the breakfast?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I see, that's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I would just have to worry about the lunch and the dinner for my- for myself and for my family.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So like for if you're spending the whole day on Sentosa Island, %uh or in Universal Studio, there are meals, there are dining options available out there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you could have like a just simple meal %um like a sandwich or something in the park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And for dinner options, %uh because %uh you'll be spending %uh quite a fair amount on your hotel stay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe I can recommend you %uh to do like our street food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh is %uh %um are street food is available on Sentosa Island?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes we do have a food court %uh located on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh for a meal with drink, let's say a main course with a drink that would cost you approximately about ten dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, ten dollars per person.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Per person.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah ten Singapore dollars per person.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, and this %uh food court on Sentosa Island, %uh they serve street food just like on the mainland?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so you can have like %uh fried Hokkien noodles, %uh a fried carrot cake, alright, satay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Satay, yah I've heard of that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh that first one you mention, fried carrot cake, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, fried carrot cake.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What's that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that for breakfast?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that like desert?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What is that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our fried be~ %uh carrot cake version is very different from %uh the American fried %uh carrot cake or the European versions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is a savoury %uh kind of egg with white radish.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: White radish.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's actually white radish that has been grated %uh and with rice flour.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's cooked like a little bit- some of them cook it like pancake style.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's the savoury and we can eat it for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Breakfast, lunch or dinner.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the whole day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, it's actually quite filling, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is something that is %uh I think not found in your country.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you may want to try that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I think we do.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Actually %um one of our things that we do is %uh we try to taste as many of the street or the local foods as possible.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I think this fried carrot cake would be one of them, if we do decide to go to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Anything else that we can try?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Anything exotic or %uh maybe challenging to try?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Challenging, okay, eating with your hands would be like either the chili crabs or %uh pepper crabs, this will be challenging.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or if you really want something very exotic, %uh we do take %uh the turtle soup in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Turtle soup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But again not many %um %uh not many %uh food court will offer this option.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you would be able to find them in Chinatown for this particular dish.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are talking about very exotic food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay and %uh what else can we expect %uh from the street food, yah?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we do have- From the street food I think it will be like Satay at %uh at the Satay club over at old %uh Lau Pa Sat.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %hm, okay and what's that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and that is- okay, what is Satay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Satay is marinated meat %uh cooked- %uh pierced with skewers and it's cooked over charcoal.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so that is Satay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And if things get a bit too maybe strange for my son, %uh my son really likes fast food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there %uh- what are the fast food restaurants available in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the fast food that is available here would ranges from McDonalds, %uh McDonalds right up to Wendy's, KFC.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This would be some of the %uh fast food that we have here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, pretty standard and stuff, okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright so %um I'm guessing %uh with the accommodations, %uh with the food and the entrance fees, %uh maybe around seven to may be eight hundred dollars, US dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is a good amount of money to have %uh as a budget?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, that's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because if you are going to stay in a %uh I would say %uh %um %uh above- let say about three to four hundred dollars stay in the res~ %uh in the hotel, then you could actually %um of course take a chance to %uh taste all our local food, our street food in full.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, sounds interesting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so %uh besides-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Let see, anything else?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, this is what I'm going to show you is claypot rice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, what is this?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a rice cooked in a claypot, so you get this aroma and of course %uh most of the time %uh they have either- you can ask for seafood or Chinese sausage or chicken %uh %um in this dish, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's like one pot meal.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so this is another food that you may want to try.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh so there is rice underneath and it's %uh cooked along with the meat?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah meat and %uh a bit of %uh vegetables.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And this is only for four dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes %uh in the non-air-conditioned food centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh that's fi~ %Oh what is the average temperature in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh average temperature in the afternoon %uh ranges from about thirty degrees to thirty two degrees %uh any time of the year.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in the mor~ in the evening from let say eight o'clock onwards, %uh the temperature will go down to twenty six degrees right up to the morning %uh about seven o'clock in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so we don't have drastic change of temperature.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh that's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the open air is just fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright and this restaurant is on Bugis, Bugis Street or Bugis what is that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This Bugis remember earlier on I also introduce to %uh like a no brand kind of a shopping?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Orchid Road.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, so in all our shopping centre, there's always %uh air-conditioned food court.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but the Bugis one it's open air, so you can- of course try this food, it is sold in either %uh air-condition food centre or non-air-conditioned food centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The non-air-condition %uh food centre would be, the prices would be a little bit cheaper.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So let say you could get it for four dollars and if you're going to have %uh your- the same kind of food in air-condition %uh food centre, then you pay about six dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see, alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I have one more very important questions.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um my family and I went to India %uh maybe a few years back.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And the water there was not very %uh potable.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Ri~ when we actually drink water there, we got sick.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh I guess, I'm guessing, that Singapore does not have that problem, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Oh n~ Yes, our water here is very clean.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you don't really have %uh very weak stomach, we can actually drink directly from the tap.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but of course again, you are not so sure whether your stomach can take it or not.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then of course I still recommend you to take the boiled water or yes or bottled water.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But otherwise our tap water is very clean %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Bottled water.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's fine, alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because we try that in India and it was a bad idea.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So thank you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so %eh once you turn on the tap, you get clean water.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Clean water.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And that goes for all the hotels, all the  %uh establishments in %uh Sentosa and also on the mainland, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you get clean water throughout %uh all the areas in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, Lynnette %uh thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think I got everything that I need.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %uh based on this conversation with you, I think I think we will plan a trip to Singapore some time really soon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Pleasure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we hope to see you soon then.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So- So thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, welcome.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: bye.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, bye.
